actionTemplate.title: Drooping-Tail Brow
steps: Keep the tail slightly lower and the arch modest for softness
Set the lower edge with the tail a bit below the brow head
Bring the top line down into a thinner tail (don't break it)
Blur the front and deepen the tail for a gentle gradient
Brush out the tail so it stays soft, not tired-looking

rationaleTemplate: Gives a gentle, tender vibe when done softly.
Managing tail intensity prevents a droopy, sleepy look.
